1.text: My son! my law forget not, And my commands let thy heart keep,

2.text: For length of days and years, Life and peace they do add to thee.

3.text: Let not kindness and truth forsake thee, Bind them on thy neck, Write them on the tablet of thy heart,

4.text: And find grace and good understanding In the eyes of God and man.

5.text: Trust unto Jehovah with all thy heart, And unto thine own understanding lean not.

6.text: In all thy ways know thou Him, And He doth make straight thy paths.

7.text: Be not wise in thine own eyes, Fear Jehovah, and turn aside from evil.

8.text: Healing it is to thy navel, And moistening to thy bones.

9.text: Honour Jehovah from thy substance, And from the beginning of all thine increase;

10.text: And filled are thy barns with plenty, And with new wine thy presses break forth.

11.text: Chastisement of Jehovah, my son, despise not, And be not vexed with His reproof,

12.text: For whom Jehovah loveth He reproveth, Even as a father the son He is pleased with.

13.text: O the happiness of a man who hath found wisdom, And of a man who bringeth forth understanding.

14.text: For better is her merchandise Than the merchandise of silver, And than gold—her increase.

15.text: Precious she is above rubies, And all thy pleasures are not comparable to her.

16.text: Length of days is in her right hand, In her left are wealth and honour.

17.text: Her ways are ways of pleasantness, And all her paths are peace.

18.text: A tree of life she is to those laying hold on her, And whoso is retaining her is happy.

19.text: Jehovah by wisdom did found the earth, He prepared the heavens by understanding.

20.text: By His knowledge depths have been rent, And clouds do drop dew.

21.text: My son! let them not turn from thine eyes, Keep thou wisdom and thoughtfulness,

22.text: And they are life to thy soul, and grace to thy neck.

23.text: Then thou goest thy way confidently, And thy foot doth not stumble.

24.text: If thou liest down, thou art not afraid, Yea, thou hast lain down, And sweet hath been thy sleep.

25.text: Be not afraid of sudden fear, And of the desolation of the wicked when it cometh.

26.text: For Jehovah is at thy side, And He hath kept thy foot from capture.

27.text: Withhold not good from its owners, When thy hand is toward God to do it.

28.text: Say not thou to thy friend, ‘Go, and return, and to-morrow I give,’ And substance with thee.

29.text: Devise not against thy neighbour evil, And he sitting confidently with thee.

30.text: Strive not with a man without cause, If he have not done thee evil.

31.text: Be not envious of a man of violence, Nor fix thou on any of his ways.

32.text: For an abomination to Jehovah is the perverted, And with the upright is His secret counsel.

33.text: The curse of Jehovah is in the house of the wicked. And the habitation of the righteous He blesseth.

34.text: If the scorners He doth scorn, Yet to the humble He doth give grace.

35.text: Honour do the wise inherit, And fools are bearing away shame!
